items.content: Donald Trump has said the Kennedy Center will close for two years in plans that are fuelling the growing controversy over the Washington DC arts venue.

The Kennedy Center Board of Trustees voted in what they say was a unanimous decision to rename the facility "The Donald J. Trump and The…

items.standfirst: Complete closure of the performing arts center in Washington, D.C., will start on July 4, Mr. Trump said in a social media post.
items.content: Complete closure of the performing arts center in Washington, D.C., will start on July 4, Mr. Trump said in a social media post.

items.content: US president says the arts complex will close for two years for reconstruction starting in July.

items.content: Remodelling of top performing arts facility is latest attempt by US president to put his stamp on Washington

items.title: Kennedy Center to close for two years for renovations, Trump says
items.standfirst: The move follows several artists cancelling performances after it was recently renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.
items.content: The move follows several artists cancelling performances after it was recently renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

items.title: Kennedy Center to close for 2 years for construction in July, Trump says
items.standfirst: President Trump says he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center for two years. It follows a wave of cancellations since Trump ousted the previous leadership and added his name to the building.
items.content: President Trump says he will move to close Washington's Kennedy Center for two years. It follows a wave of cancellations since Trump ousted the previous leadership and added his name to the building.(Image credit: Mark Schiefelbein)

items.title: Kennedy Center will halt entertainment operations for two years, Trump says
items.standfirst: DC arts venue, which has seen wave of canceled events after Trump’s takeover, will start renovations in JulyThe John F Kennedy Center, a world-class venue for the performing arts in Washington DC, will halt entertainment events for two years starting on 4 July during renovations, Donald Trump posted on Sunday on Truth Social.The Kennedy Center, which has seen a wave of performers cancel events in recent months as well as the lowest ticket sales in years, has been in turmoil since the president orchestrated a leadership overhaul in the beginning of his term. Continue reading...
items.content: DC arts venue, which has seen wave of canceled events after Trump’s takeover, will start renovations in JulyThe John F Kennedy Center, a world-class venue for the performing arts in Washington DC, will halt entertainment events for two years starting on 4 July during renovations, Donald Trump posted on Sunday on Truth Social.The Kennedy Center, which has seen a wave of performers cancel events in recent months as well as the lowest ticket sales in years, has been in turmoil since the president orchestrated a leadership overhaul in the beginning of his term. Continue reading...

ai_summary: Kennedy Center to close for two years for renovations
Trump announces closure in social media post
Closure sparks controversy over DC arts venue
Renovations to start on July 4
Several artists cancel performances after Trump's takeover

clusters.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopens for limited traffic

items.title: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopens for limited traffic
items.standfirst: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step as the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead, according to Egyptian and Israeli security officials.
items.content: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step as the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire moves ahead, according to Egyptian and Israeli security officials.(Image credit: Mohammed Arafat)

items.title: Gaza’s Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopens for limited travel – latest updates
items.standfirst: Rafah crossing in the south, which has largely been closed since May 2024, has reopened for those travelling on footIsrael says it will suspend Médecins Sans Frontières’s operations in Gaza after the humanitarian organization refused to hand over personal details of its staff members to Israeli authorities.In a statement released over the weekend, MSF said:Following many months of unsuccessful engagement with Israeli authorities, and in the absence of securing assurances to ensure the safety of our staff or the independent management of our operations, Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) has concluded that it will not share a list of its Palestinian and international staff with Israeli authorities in the current circumstances. Continue reading...
items.content: Rafah crossing in the south, which has largely been closed since May 2024, has reopened for those travelling on footIsrael says it will suspend Médecins Sans Frontières’s operations in Gaza after the humanitarian organization refused to hand over personal details of its staff members to Israeli authorities.In a statement released over the weekend, MSF said:Following many months of unsuccessful engagement with Israeli authorities, and in the absence of securing assurances to ensure the safety of our staff or the independent management of our operations, Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) has concluded that it will not share a list of its Palestinian and international staff with Israeli authorities in the current circumstances. Continue reading...

items.content: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt reopened on Monday for limited traffic, a key step as the Israeli-Hamas ceasefire​ moves ahead, Egyptian and Israeli security officials said.

items.content: Only dozens of Palestinians and no goods will be able to cross in both directions each day.

items.content: Reopening of the link between the enclave and Egypt is stipulated under the second phase of the US-brokered 'ceasefire'.

items.title: Gaza's Rafah crossing with Egypt reopens for limited number of Palestinians
items.standfirst: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday. An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening.
items.content: Gaza's Rafah border crossing with Egypt has reopened to a limited amount of foot traffic, an Israeli security official said Monday. An Egyptian official said that 50 Palestinians would cross in each direction on the first day of the crossing's reopening.

items.content: Gaza's crossing with Egypt to reopen under tight security and international monitoring for medical evacuations.

items.title: Gaza patients in limbo amid Israel’s ‘pilot reopening’ of Rafah crossing
items.standfirst: The Rafah crossing’s pilot opening begins amid confusion as Gaza’s patients face unclear criteria, limited travel slots.
items.content: The Rafah crossing’s pilot opening begins amid confusion as Gaza’s patients face unclear criteria, limited travel slots.

items.title: Israel to halt MSF work in Gaza, NGO slams ‘pretext to obstruct’ aid
items.standfirst: Israel on Sunday announced that it was terminating Doctors Without Borders or Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) operations in Gaza over its failure to provide a list of Palestinian staff. MSF called the decision a "pretext to obstruct humanitarian assistance" to Gaza and said it did not hand over staff names because Israeli authorities failed to provide assurances to guarantee their safety.
items.content: Israel on Sunday announced that it was terminating Doctors Without Borders or Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) operations in Gaza over its failure to provide a list of Palestinian staff. MSF called the decision a "pretext to obstruct humanitarian assistance" to Gaza and said it did not hand over staff names because Israeli authorities failed to provide assurances to guarantee their safety.

items.title: Gaza’s Rafah crossing to reopen for Palestinians on Monday, Israel says
items.standfirst: Officials say Gaza residents travelling on foot only will be allowed through border point, which was shut in May 2024Gaza’s main border crossing in Rafah will reopen for Palestinians on Monday, Israel has said, with preparations under way at the war-ravaged territory’s gateway, which has been mostly closed for almost two years.Before the war, the Rafah crossing with Egypt was the only direct exit point for most Palestinians in Gaza to reach the outside world as well as a key entry point for aid. It has been largely shut since May 2024. Continue reading...
items.content: Officials say Gaza residents travelling on foot only will be allowed through border point, which was shut in May 2024Gaza’s main border crossing in Rafah will reopen for Palestinians on Monday, Israel has said, with preparations under way at the war-ravaged territory’s gateway, which has been mostly closed for almost two years.Before the war, the Rafah crossing with Egypt was the only direct exit point for most Palestinians in Gaza to reach the outside world as well as a key entry point for aid. It has been largely shut since May 2024. Continue reading...

items.title: Rafah crossing will open between Gaza and Egypt on Monday
items.standfirst: A key border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt is expected to partially open Monday, with Egyptian officials readying help for sick and injured Palestinians
items.content: A key border crossing between the Gaza Strip and Egypt is expected to partially open Monday, with Egyptian officials readying help for sick and injured Palestinians

ai_summary: Rafah border crossing reopens for limited traffic

No goods allowed to cross
Reopening part of Israeli-Hamas ceasefire agreement

DTEK Group, Ukraine's largest private energy company, said a Russian drone struck a bus…

items.title: Russian drone attack on bus in Ukraine kills at least 12
items.standfirst: Russian drone strike kills 12 mine workers in Ukraine's Dnipropetrovsk region, injuring seven others.
items.content: Russian drone strike kills 12 mine workers in Ukraine's Dnipropetrovsk region, injuring seven others.

items.title: Russian drone attack on bus carrying mine workers in Ukraine kills at least 12
items.standfirst: Employees of Ukraine’s largest private energy firm, DTEK, were travelling about 40 miles from frontline, says policeA Russian drone attack on a bus carrying mine workers in Ukraine’s central-eastern Dnipropetrovsk region has killed at least 12 people, officials said.The bus was driving about 40 miles (65km) from the frontline, according to police. Images published by Ukraine’s state emergency service showed what appeared to be an empty bus, its side windows shattered and windscreen hanging from the front. Continue reading...
items.content: Employees of Ukraine’s largest private energy firm, DTEK, were travelling about 40 miles from frontline, says policeA Russian drone attack on a bus carrying mine workers in Ukraine’s central-eastern Dnipropetrovsk region has killed at least 12 people, officials said.The bus was driving about 40 miles (65km) from the frontline, according to police. Images published by Ukraine’s state emergency service showed what appeared to be an empty bus, its side windows shattered and windscreen hanging from the front. Continue reading...

items.title: Russian drone strike on bus transporting Ukrainian energy sector workers kills 15
items.standfirst: A Russian drone attack on a bus carrying miners in Ukraine's southeastern Dnipropetrovsk region on Sunday killed 15 employees returning from their shift, the company that owned the bus said. Ukrainian Energy Minister Denys Shmyhal called it a "cynical and targeted attack" on the country's energy sector as the country copes with one of the harshest winters in recent memory.
items.content: A Russian drone attack on a bus carrying miners in Ukraine's southeastern Dnipropetrovsk region on Sunday killed 15 employees returning from their shift, the company that owned the bus said. Ukrainian Energy Minister Denys Shmyhal called it a "cynical and targeted attack" on the country's energy sector as the country copes with one of the harshest winters in recent memory.

items.title: Russia strikes a maternity hospital and a miner's bus in Ukraine, killing at least 21
items.standfirst: Fifteen people were killed ​and seven wounded after a Russian drone struck a ‍bus carrying miners in Ukraine's southeastern Dnipropetrovsk region, energy firm DTEK and government officials said ​on Sunday. Earlier on Sunday, regional officials said at least nine had been wounded in Russian strikes on a maternity hospital and a residential building in the southeastern city of Zaporizhzhia. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Kharkiv, Emmanuelle Chaze.
items.content: Fifteen people were killed ​and seven wounded after a Russian drone struck a ‍bus carrying miners in Ukraine's southeastern Dnipropetrovsk region, energy firm DTEK and government officials said ​on Sunday. Earlier on Sunday, regional officials said at least nine had been wounded in Russian strikes on a maternity hospital and a residential building in the southeastern city of Zaporizhzhia. Details by FRANCE 24 correspondent in Kharkiv, Emmanuelle Chaze.

ai_summary: Russian drone strike kills 12 miners in Ukraine
Strike occurs near bus carrying workers
Eight others injured in the attack
Attack blamed on Russian drone
Incident sparks outrage and condemnation

items.title: ICE releases 5-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father from custody
items.standfirst: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father were released from ICE custody on Sunday, a day after a federal court ordered their release.
items.content: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and his father were released from ICE custody on Sunday, a day after a federal court ordered their release.

items.title: Five-year-old boy and father detained by ICE return home to Minnesota
items.standfirst: Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian, were accompanied home by Texas Democratic Representative Joaquin Castro.
items.content: Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian, were accompanied home by Texas Democratic Representative Joaquin Castro.

items.title: Five-year-old Liam Conejo Ramos and father return to Minnesota after ICE detention
items.standfirst: A five-year-old boy whose detention in the Trump administration's aggressive immigration raids in Minneapolis shocked the world returned to Minnesota, a lawmaker said Sunday. Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian Conejo Arias, were detained in a Minneapolis suburb on January 20 and held at an ICE facility in Texas before their release.
items.content: A five-year-old boy whose detention in the Trump administration's aggressive immigration raids in Minneapolis shocked the world returned to Minnesota, a lawmaker said Sunday. Liam Conejo Ramos and his father, Adrian Conejo Arias, were detained in a Minneapolis suburb on January 20 and held at an ICE facility in Texas before their release.

items.title: Boy, 5, and father detained by ICE return to Minnesota after release
items.standfirst: The boy was released on the order of a judge who said his detention was "cruel" and "bereft of human decency”.
items.content: The boy was released on the order of a judge who said his detention was "cruel" and "bereft of human decency”.

ai_summary: Five year old boy and father released from ICE custody
Release ordered by federal court
Boy and father detained in Minneapolis suburb
Detention sparked outrage and criticism
Release welcomed by lawmakers and advocates

items.title: UK’s Peter Mandelson resigns from Labour party after Epstein ties resurface
items.standfirst: Former British ambassador to Washington Peter Mandelson quit the Labour Party on Sunday after newly released US documents revived scrutiny of his links to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Mandelson said he wanted to avoid causing “further embarrassment” and denied wrongdoing.
items.content: Former British ambassador to Washington Peter Mandelson quit the Labour Party on Sunday after newly released US documents revived scrutiny of his links to late sex offender Jeffrey Epstein. Mandelson said he wanted to avoid causing “further embarrassment” and denied wrongdoing.

items.title: Mandelson resigns from Labour to prevent ‘further embarrassment’ over Epstein links
items.standfirst: Departure from party follows release of documents in US appearing to show Jeffrey Epstein sent former US ambassador $75,000Peter Mandelson has said he has resigned his membership of the Labour party to avoid causing it “further embarrassment” after more revelations about his friendship with Jeffrey Epstein.The peer, who was sacked as US ambassador last year because of his links to Epstein, featured in documents released by the US Department of Justice on Friday related to the convicted sex offender. Continue reading...

items.title: Venezuela rights activist Javier Tarazona freed amid prisoner release
items.standfirst: Tarazona freed after four years in prison on 'terrorism' and conspiracy charges.
items.content: Tarazona freed after four years in prison on 'terrorism' and conspiracy charges.

items.title: Venezuela frees prominent human rights activist Javier Tarazona
items.standfirst: Prominent Venezuelan human rights activist Javier Tarazona was released after more than four years in jail, a legal rights group said Sunday. Tarazona was arrested in July 2021, and is the latest in a spate of high-profile political prisoner releases by Venezuela's interim authorities since the January 3 ouster of former leader Nicolas Maduro.
items.content: Prominent Venezuelan human rights activist Javier Tarazona was released after more than four years in jail, a legal rights group said Sunday. Tarazona was arrested in July 2021, and is the latest in a spate of high-profile political prisoner releases by Venezuela's interim authorities since the January 3 ouster of former leader Nicolas Maduro.

ai_summary: Venezuela releases human rights activist Javier Tarazona

Tarazona arrested on terrorism and conspiracy charges
Release welcomed by human rights groups

items.title: Waymo Seeking About $16 Billion Near $110 Billion Valuation

items.title: Will corporate America finally stand up to the Trump administration?

Weeks of growing national anger over deadly immigration crackdowns in the US have highlighted how much has changed. Publicly, the US’s top CEOs…

items.title: Will corporate America finally stand up to the Trump administration?
items.standfirst: The brutal handling of immigration raids and the killing of Alex Pretti have tested the reticence of the corporate classDuring Donald Trump’s first term, the US’s corporate titans were prepared to literally turn their backs on the president when they disagreed with him. Weeks of growing national anger over deadly immigration crackdowns in the US have highlighted how much has changed.Publicly, the US’s top CEOs have stayed – mostly – quiet during Trump’s second term, even as his administration has undermined free trade policies, cracked down on the immigration that many businesses relied on, and attacked the Federal Reserve – a pillar of the US’s financial hegemony. Continue reading...
items.content: The brutal handling of immigration raids and the killing of Alex Pretti have tested the reticence of the corporate classDuring Donald Trump’s first term, the US’s corporate titans were prepared to literally turn their backs on the president when they disagreed with him. Weeks of growing national anger over deadly immigration crackdowns in the US have highlighted how much has changed.Publicly, the US’s top CEOs have stayed – mostly – quiet during Trump’s second term, even as his administration has undermined free trade policies, cracked down on the immigration that many businesses relied on, and attacked the Federal Reserve – a pillar of the US’s financial hegemony. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Portland mayor demands ICE leave city after federal agents teargas protesters
clusters.neutral_headline: Portland Mayor Demands ICE Leave City

items.title: Portland mayor demands ICE leave city after federal agents teargas protesters
items.standfirst: Witnesses say protest outside ICE facility was peaceful until agents deployed teargas and rubber bullets around childrenThe mayor of Portland, Oregon, demanded US Immigration and Customs Enforcement leave his city after federal agents launched teargas at a crowd of demonstrators – including young children – outside an ICE facility during a weekend protest that he and others characterized as peaceful.Witnesses said agents deployed teargas, pepper balls and rubber bullets as thousands of marchers arrived at the South Waterfront facility on Saturday. Erin Hoover Barnett, a former OregonLive reporter who joined the protest, said she was about 100 yards (91 metres) from the building when “what looked like two guys with rocket launchers” started dousing the crowd with gas. Continue reading...
items.content: Witnesses say protest outside ICE facility was peaceful until agents deployed teargas and rubber bullets around childrenThe mayor of Portland, Oregon, demanded US Immigration and Customs Enforcement leave his city after federal agents launched teargas at a crowd of demonstrators – including young children – outside an ICE facility during a weekend protest that he and others characterized as peaceful.Witnesses said agents deployed teargas, pepper balls and rubber bullets as thousands of marchers arrived at the South Waterfront facility on Saturday. Erin Hoover Barnett, a former OregonLive reporter who joined the protest, said she was about 100 yards (91 metres) from the building when “what looked like two guys with rocket launchers” started dousing the crowd with gas. Continue reading...

items.title: Portland mayor demands ICE leave the city after federal agents gas protesters
items.standfirst: Children were among a crowd of "ICE out" protesters in Portland on Saturday, witnesses said.
items.content: Children were among a crowd of "ICE out" protesters in Portland on Saturday, witnesses said.

ai_summary: Portland mayor demands ICE leave the city

items.title: Alcaraz beats Djokovic to become the youngest man to complete a career Grand Slam
items.standfirst: The 22-year-old Spaniard's win against 38-year-old rival Novak Djokovic at Sunday's Australian Open makes him the youngest male player to win all four major tournaments.
items.content: The 22-year-old Spaniard's win against 38-year-old rival Novak Djokovic at Sunday's Australian Open makes him the youngest male player to win all four major tournaments.(Image credit: Mark Baker)
